Calculate Total and Mean Wave Energy at Coastal Points

calculate_waves.Rd

This function calculates daily and total wave energy at specified coastal points using wind data and fetch distances for each directional bearing. Optionally supports parallel processing.

Usage

calculate_waves(wind, fetch, points, parallel = TRUE, cores = 9)

Arguments

wind

A data.frame or tibble with columns date, bearing, and windspeed_ms (wind speed in m/s).

fetch

An sf object with columns id, bearing, and length_km, typically returned by calculate_fetch().

points

An sf object with coastal points and an id column to join wave energy estimates.

parallel

Logical. If TRUE, enables parallel processing using furrr::future_map_dfr. Default is TRUE.

cores

Integer. Number of workers to use if parallel is enabled. (Note: must be set via future::plan() externally.)

Value

An sf object with original points and two new columns:

  • wave_energy: total cumulative wave energy (arbitrary units).

  • wave_mean: daily mean wave energy over the time series.

Details

Wave energy is approximated using wind stress scaled by cosine of angular difference between wind and fetch bearing: $$wave\_energy = \tau \cdot \cos(\theta) \cdot \text{fetch}$$ where \(\tau\) is wind stress and \(\theta\) is angular difference.

Wind stress is calculated using: $$\tau = 0.001 \cdot (1.1 + 0.035 \cdot U) \cdot U^2$$ where \(U\) is wind speed in m/s.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  future::plan(multisession, workers = 4)
  wave_output <- calculate_waves(wind_df, fetch_sf, points_sf, parallel = TRUE, cores = 4)
} # }
